articles.title: Vocabulaire de Restaurant en Espagnol
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

Quoi de plus romantique qu'un d√Æner dans un restaurant espagnol ? Que vous soyez en Espagne, en Am√©rique latine ou simplement dans un restaurant hispanophone pr√®s de chez vous, ma√Ætriser le vocabulaire du restaurant vous permettra de vivre une exp√©rience culinaire authentique avec votre partenaire.

## Arriver au restaurant

### R√©server et se pr√©senter

<VocabCard

  translation="r√©servation"

/>

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| Buenas noches | Bonsoir | BOU√â-nass NO-tch√©ss |

<PhraseOfDay

### Demander des pr√©f√©rences

| ¬øHay una mesa m√°s tranquila? | Y a-t-il une table plus tranquille ? |

<CultureTip title="Les horaires des repas en Espagne" flag="üá™üá∏">
En Espagne, les horaires de repas sont tr√®s diff√©rents de la France ! Le d√©jeuner (la comida) se prend entre 14h et 16h, et le d√Æner (la cena) rarement avant 21h-22h. Les restaurants sont souvent vides √† 19h ! Adaptez-vous √† ce rythme pour une exp√©rience authentique.
</CultureTip>

## Lire le menu

### Types de plats

<VocabCard

## Commander

### Phrases pour commander

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|----------|----------|
| ¬øEst√°n listos para pedir? | √ätes-vous pr√™ts √† commander ? |

### Demander des d√©tails

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |

| ¬øQu√© lleva este plato? | Qu'est-ce qu'il y a dans ce plat ? |
| ¬øEs picante? | C'est √©pic√© ? |

### Pr√©f√©rences alimentaires

<CultureTip title="Les tapas - l'art du partage" flag="üá™üá∏">
En Espagne, les tapas sont faites pour √™tre partag√©es ! C'est une excellente fa√ßon de d√©couvrir plusieurs plats ensemble. Commandez plusieurs tapas et partagez-les avec votre partenaire - c'est tr√®s romantique et tr√®s espagnol !

## Pendant le repas

### Appeler le serveur

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|

| Nos falta... | Il nous manque... | noss FAL-ta |
| ¬øNos puede traer m√°s pan? | Pouvez-vous nous apporter plus de pain ? | noss POU√â-d√© tra-√àR mass pan |

<VocabCard

/>

### Ce dont vous pourriez avoir besoin

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|----------|----------|
| agua | eau |

| sal | sel |
| pimienta | poivre |

## Les boissons

### Commander des boissons

<VocabCard
  word="vino tinto"
  translation="vin rouge"

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|----------|----------|
| agua con gas | eau gazeuse |

| una copa de vino | un verre de vin |

| vino rosado | vin ros√© |

### Trinquer en couple

|----------|----------|

<CultureTip title="La sobremesa" flag="üá™üá∏">
La ¬´ sobremesa ¬ª est le temps pass√© √† table apr√®s le repas, √† discuter et profiter de la compagnie. C'est une tradition espagnole sacr√©e ! Ne soyez pas press√© de partir - savourez ce moment avec votre partenaire. Un serveur ne vous apportera jamais l'addition sans que vous la demandiez.
</CultureTip>

## L'addition

### Demander et payer

<VocabCard
  word="la cuenta"
  translation="l'addition"
  pronunciation="la KOU√àN-ta"
  example="La cuenta, por favor."
/>

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |
|----------|----------|
| La cuenta, por favor | L'addition, s'il vous pla√Æt |

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais |

<CultureTip title="Le pourboire en Espagne" flag="üá™üá∏">
En Espagne, le pourboire n'est pas obligatoire comme aux √âtats-Unis. Si le service √©tait bon, il est courant de laisser quelques euros ou d'arrondir la note. Un pourboire de 5-10% est consid√©r√© comme g√©n√©reux. En Am√©rique latine, les pratiques varient selon les pays.
</CultureTip>

## Dialogues au restaurant

### Arriv√©e et installation

### Commander

### Pendant le repas

(Plus tard)

## Exercices de pratique pour couples

### Exercice 1 : Jeu de r√¥le

Simulez un d√Æner au restaurant. Un partenaire joue le serveur, l'autre le client. Puis inversez !

### Exercice 2 : Cr√©ez votre commande

Imaginez votre repas id√©al et commandez-le en espagnol :

### Exercice 3 : Que diriez-vous si...

<PhraseOfDay

## Plats espagnols √† conna√Ætre

Ma√Ætriser le vocabulaire du restaurant vous permettra de profiter pleinement de vos sorties romantiques en espagnol. Chaque repas partag√© est une occasion de pratiquer et de cr√©er des souvenirs ensemble !

articles.title: 50 Saluti e Addii in Svedese per Coppie Innamorate
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Iniziare la giornata con un dolce "god morgon, √§lskling" o chiudere la serata con un tenero "sov gott" pu√≤ trasformare le vostre routine quotidiane in momenti magici. Imparare i saluti svedesi insieme non √® solo utile per la comunicazione - √® un modo meraviglioso per mostrare amore e attenzione al vostro partner. Queste 50 espressioni vi aiuteranno a creare connessioni pi√π profonde, dalla prima mattina fino all'ultimo bacio della notte.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="God morgon, √§lskling"
  translation="Buongiorno, amore mio"
  pronunciation="gohd MOHR-gohn, EHL-skling"
  context="Il modo perfetto per svegliare il vostro partner con amore"
/>

## I Saluti del Mattino: Iniziare la Giornata con Amore

Niente √® pi√π romantico del primo saluto del giorno. In Svezia, i saluti mattutini sono speciali e pieni di affetto.

<VocabCard
  word="God morgon"
  translation="Buongiorno"
  pronunciation="gohd MOHR-gohn"
  example="God morgon, min √§lskade! Har du sovit gott?"
/>

| Svedese | Italiano | Pronuncia | Quando Usarlo |
|---------|----------|-----------|---------------|
| **God morgon** | Buongiorno | gohd MOHR-gohn | Prima del mezzogiorno |
| **Morgon, hj√§rtat** | Mattino, cuore | MOHR-gohn, YAHRT-ah | Informale, affettuoso |
| **Vakna, √§lskling** | Svegliati, amore | VAHK-nah, EHL-skling | Per svegliare dolcemente |
| **Dags att vakna** | √à ora di svegliarsi | dahks aht VAHK-nah | Pi√π energico |
| **God f√∂rmiddag** | Buon pomeriggio (prec.) | gohd FOHRM-ih-dahg | 9-12 del mattino |
| **Hej p√• dig** | Ciao (positivo) | hey poh day | Amichevole, quotidiano |

<CultureTip flag="üá∏üá™" title="I Sveglia Svedese">
I svedesi sono mattinieri! Molti si svegliano presto e apprezzano i saluti genuini. Dire "god morgon" con un sorriso √® considerato molto educato e caloroso.
</CultureTip>

## Saluti Informali: Per Ogni Momento

Quando siete insieme, questi saluti casual vi faranno sentire pi√π naturali e connessi.

<VocabCard
  word="Hej s√∂tnos"
  translation="Ciao dolcezza"
  pronunciation="hey S√ñHT-noahs"
  example="Hej s√∂tnos, hur m√•r du idag?"
/>

### Saluti Giornalieri Amichevoli

| Svedese | Italiano | Pronuncia | Contesto |
|---------|----------|-----------|----------|
| **Hej** | Ciao/Hej | hey | Universale, amichevole |
| **Tjena** | Ciao (slang) | CHEH-nah | Molto informale |
| **Hall√•** | Hall√• | hah-LOH | Con entusiasmo |
| **Hej hej** | Ciao ciao | hey hey | Pi√π caloroso |
| **Tja** | Ehi | chah | Rapido, tra amici |
| **L√§get?** | Come va? | LEE-eht | Slang per "hur √§r l√§get?" |

## Saluti Formali: Per la Famiglia e Occasioni Speciali

Quando incontrate i parenti o in situazioni pi√π formali, questi saluti vi salveranno. Per prepararvi all'incontro con la famiglia del vostro partner, date un'occhiata alla nostra guida su [come incontrare la famiglia svedese del vostro partner](/learn/it/sv/meeting-your-swedish-partners-family/).

| Svedese | Italiano | Pronuncia | Uso |
|---------|----------|-----------|-----|
| **God dag** | Buongiorno (formale) | gohd dahg | Formale, rispettoso |
| **Hur st√•r det till?** | Come sta? | hoor stohr deh teel | Formale |
| **Hur m√•r du?** | Come stai? | hoor mohr doo | Standard |
| **V√§lkommen** | Benvenuto/Bentornato | VEHl-kohm-men | Quando qualcuno arriva |
| **V√§lkommen hem** | Bentornato a casa | VEHl-kohm-men hehm | Tornando a casa |
| **Det var l√§nge sedan** | √à passato tanto tempo | deh vahr lehn-gheh SEE-dahn | Riunione dopo tempo |

## I Saluti della Sera: Concludere con Dolcezza

La sera √® il momento pi√π romantico per i saluti. Create rituali speciali con queste espressioni.

<VocabCard
  word="God natt, min √§lskade"
  translation="Buonanotte, mio amato"
  pronunciation="gohd naht, meen EHL-skah-deh"
  example="God natt, min √§lskade. Dr√∂m om mig."
/>

### Saluti Serali Romantici

| Svedese | Italiano | Pronuncia | Momento Perfetto |
|---------|----------|-----------|------------------|
| **God kv√§ll** | Buonasera | gohd kvehll | 18:00-21:00 |
| **God natt** | Buonanotte | gohd naht | Prima di dormire |
| **Sov gott** | Dormi bene | sohv goht | Dolce e affettuoso |
| **Sov s√• gott** | Dormi tanto bene | sohv soh goht | Pi√π enfatico |
| **Dr√∂m om mig** | Sognami | druhm ohm mee | Romantico |
| **Vi ses imorgon** | Ci vediamo domani | vee sahs ee-mohr-gohn | Promessa di rivedersi |

<CultureTip flag="üá∏üá™" title="Il Tempo dei Saluti">
I svedesi dividono il giorno precisamente: "god morgon" fino alle 12, "god eftermiddag" dalle 12-18, "god kv√§ll" dalle 18-21, e "god natt" dopo. Seguire queste regole mostra rispetto culturale!
</CultureTip>

## Addii per Diverse Occasioni

Dire addio non deve mai essere triste quando √® fatto con amore.

<VocabCard
  word="Hej d√•, √§lskling"
  translation="Ciao amore, arrivederci"
  pronunciation="hey doh, EHL-skling"
  example="Hej d√•, √§lskling. Jag √§lskar dig!"
/>

### Addii Romantici e Affettuosi

| Svedese | Italiano | Pronuncia | Emozione |
|---------|----------|-----------|----------|
| **Hej d√•** | Ciao/Arrivederci | hey doh | Standard |
| **Adj√∂** | Addio (definitivo) | ahd-yuh | Formale, finale |
| **Vi ses snart** | Ci vediamo presto | vee sahs snahrt | Promettente |
| **Vi ses senare** | Ci vediamo dopo | vee sahs seh-NAH-reh | Pi√π tardi |
| **Ha det bra** | Stammi bene | hah deh brah | Affettuoso |
| **Ta hand om dig** | Prenditi cura di te | tah hahnd ohm day | Premuroso |
| **Kram och puss** | Abbraccio e bacio | krahm ock pohss | Dolce e fisico |
| **Sakna mig** | Mi mancherai | SAHK-nah mee | Giocoso |

## Messaggi d'Amore nei Saluti

Per rendere i vostri saluti ancora pi√π speciali, aggiungete questi elementi romantici. Per pi√π ispirazione romantica, date un'occhiata alla nostra [guida completa alle frasi d'amore in svedese](/learn/it/sv/swedish-romantic-phrases-every-occasion/).

### Espressioni Extra-Romantiche

| Svedese | Italiano | Pronuncia | Quando Usare |
|---------|----------|-----------|---------------|
| **Min √§lskling** | Il mio amore | meen EHL-skling | Ogni giorno |
| **√Ñlskling, jag m√•ste g√•** | Amore, devo andare | EHL-skling, yahg MOOS-teh goh | Partenza tenera |
| **T√§nka p√• dig** | Penser√≤ a te | TEHN-kah oh day | Quando vi separate |
| **Du betyder allt f√∂r mig** | Sei tutto per me | doo beh-TIH-den ahlt fehr mee | Profondo |
| **Kom tillbaka snart** | Torna presto | kohme teel-BAH-kah snahrt | Aspettando |
| **Jag l√§ngtar efter dig** | Mi manchi gi√† | yahg LEHNG-tahr EH-tehr day | Desiderio |

## Come Usare i Saluti con il Vostro Partner

### Creare Rituali Speciali

1. **Mattina**: Svegliatevi 5 minuti prima per un vero "god morgon" con caff√® o th√®
2. **Separazione**: Create un vostro saluto personale che include inside jokes
3. **Ritorno**: Usate "v√§lkommen hem" anche se siete stati via solo per poche ore
4. **Notte**: Dite sempre "sov gott" con un tocco fisico - carezza o bacio

### Errori Comuni da Evitare

- Non usate "adj√∂" con il vostro partner - √® troppo definitivo!
- "Hej d√•" √® perfetto, ma aggiungete sempre qualcosa di personale
- Dimenticare i saluti serali √® considerato freddo nella cultura svedese
- Usare "tjenare" con la famiglia - √® troppo slang per i genitori

<CultureTip flag="üá∏üá™" title="Il Potere del Contatto">
In Svezia, accompagnare i saluti con contatto fisico (abbraccio, bacio sulla guancia) √® molto comune tra coppie e familiari. Non essere timido - il vostro partner apprezzer√†!
</CultureTip>

## Rendere i Saluti Indimenticabili

I saluti e gli addii sono le cornici della vostra giornata insieme. Con queste 50 espressioni svedesi, potete trasformare momenti semplici in ricordi preziosi. Ricordate: non √® solo quello che dite, ma come lo dite. Il tono, il contatto visivo √® il tocco fisico rendono ogni "hej" e "hej d√•" un atto d'amore.

Per continuare il vostro viaggio nel svedese romantico, esplorate la nostra [guida ai nomignoli svedesi per il vostro partner](/learn/it/sv/swedish-pet-names-for-your-partner/) e create un linguaggio d'amore che √® solo vostro.

<CTA />

## Po≈ºegnania podstawowe

## Po≈ºegnania dla par

### Na dobranoc

| Ukrai≈Ñski | Wymowa | Polski |

| **–°–æ–ª–æ–¥–∫–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤** | so-≈ÅOD-kych sniw | S≈Çodkich sn√≥w |
| **–°–ø–∏ –¥–æ–±—Ä–µ** | spy DO-bre | ≈öpij dobrze |
| **–î–æ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞** | do ZAW-tra | Do jutra |
| **–ü—Ä–∏—Å–Ω–∏—Å—è –º–µ–Ω—ñ** | pry-SNY-sia me-NI | Przy≈õnij mi siƒô |

## Specjalne okazje

| Ukrai≈Ñski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| **–©–∞—Å–ª–∏–≤–æ—ó –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∏!** | szczas-≈ÅY-wo-ji do-RO-hy | Szczƒô≈õliwej podr√≥≈ºy! |
| **–î–æ—ó–¥—å –±–µ–∑–ø–µ—á–Ω–æ** | do-JID' bez-PECZ-no | Dojed≈∫ bezpiecznie |
| **–ó–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω—É–π, —è–∫ –ø—Ä–∏—ó–¥–µ—à** | za-te-le-fo-NUJ, jak pry-JI-desz | Zadzwo≈Ñ, jak dojedziesz |

### Przed wa≈ºnym wydarzeniem

| **–¢–∏ –≤–ø–æ—Ä–∞—î—à—Å—è!** | ty wpo-RA-jesz-sia | Dasz radƒô! |
| **–¢—Ä–∏–º–∞—é –∫—É–ª–∞–∫–∏** | try-MA-ju ku-la-KY | Trzymam kciuki |

<CultureTip title="–ù—ñ –ø—É—Ö—É –Ω—ñ –ø–µ—Ä–∞!" flag="üá∫üá¶">
Na "–ù—ñ –ø—É—Ö—É –Ω—ñ –ø–µ—Ä–∞!" (Ani puchu ani pi√≥ra!) odpowiada siƒô "–î–æ –±—ñ—Å–∞!" (Do diab≈Ça!) - to tradycyjne ≈ºyczenie powodzenia. Bardzo podobne do rosyjskiego i polskiego odpukiwania!
</CultureTip>

## ƒÜwiczenia dla par

### ƒÜwiczenie 1: Poranna rutyna
Przez tydzie≈Ñ witajcie siƒô rano po ukrai≈Ñsku:
- "–î–æ–±—Ä–∏–π —Ä–∞–Ω–æ–∫, —Å–æ–Ω–µ—á–∫–æ!"

### ƒÜwiczenie 3: Wieczorna rutyna

## Podsumowanie

Ukrai≈Ñskie powitania sƒÖ ciep≈Çe i bardzo podobne do polskich! Pamiƒôtaj: "–î–æ–±—Ä–∏–π –¥–µ–Ω—å" formalne, "–ü—Ä–∏–≤—ñ—Ç" nieformalne. Miƒôdzy sobƒÖ u≈ºywajcie czu≈Çych "—Å–æ–Ω–µ—á–∫–æ", "–∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–π/–∞"!

- **[Wymowa ukrai≈Ñska](/learn/pl/uk/ukrainian-pronunciation-guide/)** - Cyrylica i d≈∫wiƒôki
- **[S≈Çownictwo na randkƒô](/learn/pl/uk/ukrainian-date-night-vocabulary/)** - Romantyczne zwroty

articles.title: French Romantic Phrases for Every Occasion: Complete Guide
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

French is known as the language of love for good reason. Its melodic sounds and romantic vocabulary create the perfect atmosphere for expressing your deepest feelings. This comprehensive guide covers romantic French phrases for every stage of your relationship - from that first spark to lifelong devotion.

## Saying "I Love You" in Different Ways

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Je t'aime"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="[zhuh TEHM]"
  context="The most powerful phrase in French - use it when you truly mean it"
/>

### Levels of Love Expression

French has different expressions for different depths of feeling:

| French | English | Intensity | When to Use |
|--------|---------|-----------|-------------|
| Je t'aime bien | I like you | Light | Friends, early dating |
| Je t'adore | I adore you | Medium | Affectionate, casual |
| Je t'aime | I love you | Strong | Serious romantic love |
| Je suis amoureux/amoureuse de toi | I'm in love with you | Very strong | Deep romantic feelings |
| Je t'aime a la folie | I love you madly | Intense | Passionate declaration |
| Je t'aime de tout mon coeur | I love you with all my heart | Deep | Sincere, heartfelt |
| Je t'aime plus que tout | I love you more than anything | Ultimate | Complete devotion |

<VocabCard
  word="Je suis fou/folle de toi"
  translation="I'm crazy about you"
  pronunciation="[zhuh swee FOO/FOLL duh TWAH]"
  example="Depuis que je t'ai rencontre(e), je suis fou de toi."
/>

<CultureTip title="When French Say 'Je t'aime'" flag="üá´üá∑">
In France, "Je t'aime" is reserved for romantic love and is not said casually. Unlike in English where "I love you" might be said to friends and family easily, the French typically use "Je t'adore" for strong affection and save "Je t'aime" for their romantic partner. Saying it carries significant weight!
</CultureTip>

## First Meeting and Flirting

### Breaking the Ice

| French | English | Pronunciation |
|--------|---------|---------------|
| Tu as de beaux yeux | You have beautiful eyes | [too ah duh boh ZYUH] |
| Tu es vraiment charmant(e) | You're really charming | [too ay vray-MAHN shar-MAHNT] |
| Je peux t'offrir un verre? | Can I buy you a drink? | [zhuh puh toh-FREER uhn VEHR] |
| Tu viens souvent ici? | Do you come here often? | [too vee-AHN soo-VAHN ee-SEE] |
| Tu me plais beaucoup | I really like you | [too muh PLAY boh-KOO] |

<VocabCard
  word="Tu as un sourire magnifique"
  translation="You have a magnificent smile"
  pronunciation="[too ah uhn soo-REER mah-nyee-FEEK]"
  example="Tu sais quoi? Tu as un sourire magnifique."
/>

### Flirtatious Compliments

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Tu es ravissant(e) | You're ravishing |
| Tu es craquant(e) | You're irresistible |
| Tu me fais craquer | You make me melt |
| Tu as du charme | You have charm |
| Je ne peux pas detourner mon regard | I can't take my eyes off you |
| Tu as un je-ne-sais-quoi | You have that certain something |

<VocabCard
  word="Je n'arrive pas a te sortir de ma tete"
  translation="I can't get you out of my head"
  pronunciation="[zhuh nah-REEV pah ah tuh sor-TEER duh ma TET]"
  example="Depuis qu'on s'est rencontres, je n'arrive pas a te sortir de ma tete."
/>

## Early Relationship Phrases

### Expressing Growing Feelings

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Tu me manques | I miss you |
| J'ai hate de te voir | I can't wait to see you |
| Je pense a toi tout le temps | I think about you all the time |
| Tu illumines ma journee | You light up my day |
| Je suis si bien avec toi | I feel so good with you |
| Tu me rends heureux/heureuse | You make me happy |

<VocabCard
  word="Chaque moment avec toi est precieux"
  translation="Every moment with you is precious"
  pronunciation="[shahk moh-MAHN ah-vek TWAH ay pray-see-UH]"
  example="Je le pense vraiment - chaque moment avec toi est precieux."
/>

### Asking Someone Out

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Tu voudrais sortir avec moi? | Would you like to go out with me? |
| Je t'invite a diner | I'm inviting you to dinner |
| Tu es libre ce soir? | Are you free tonight? |
| On se voit quand? | When shall we see each other? |
| J'aimerais te revoir | I'd like to see you again |

<VocabCard
  word="Est-ce que tu voudrais etre mon/ma petit(e) ami(e)?"
  translation="Would you like to be my boyfriend/girlfriend?"
  pronunciation="[ess-kuh too voo-DRAY eh-truh mohn/ma puh-TEE ah-MEE]"
  example="Ca fait quelques mois qu'on se voit... Est-ce que tu voudrais etre ma petite amie?"
/>

<CultureTip title="French Dating Culture" flag="üá´üá∑">
In France, there's no strict "dating" phase like in American culture. French people often go from being friends to being "together" (ensemble) without a formal "exclusive" conversation. The relationship status is often understood implicitly rather than explicitly discussed.
</CultureTip>

## Deep Love and Commitment

### Expressing Devotion

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Tu es l'amour de ma vie | You are the love of my life |
| Je veux passer ma vie avec toi | I want to spend my life with you |
| Tu es mon ame soeur | You are my soulmate |
| Je t'aimerai pour toujours | I will love you forever |
| Tu es ma moitie | You are my other half |
| Sans toi, je ne suis rien | Without you, I am nothing |
| Tu es tout pour moi | You are everything to me |

<VocabCard
  word="Tu es la meilleure chose qui me soit arrivee"
  translation="You are the best thing that ever happened to me"
  pronunciation="[too ay la may-YUHR shohz kee muh swah ah-ree-VAY]"
  example="Je le pense du fond du coeur - tu es la meilleure chose qui me soit arrivee."
/>

### Marriage and Forever

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Veux-tu m'epouser? | Will you marry me? |
| Je veux vieillir avec toi | I want to grow old with you |
| Je serai toujours la pour toi | I will always be there for you |
| Tu es mon present et mon avenir | You are my present and my future |
| Jusqu'a ce que la mort nous separe | Until death do us part |

<VocabCard
  word="Je veux construire une vie avec toi"
  translation="I want to build a life with you"
  pronunciation="[zhuh vuh kon-STRWEER oon VEE ah-vek TWAH]"
  example="Mon amour, je veux construire une vie avec toi."
/>

## Daily Affection Phrases

### Good Morning/Goodnight

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Bonjour, mon amour | Good morning, my love |
| Bonne nuit, mon coeur | Goodnight, my heart |
| Fais de beaux reves | Have sweet dreams |
| Je t'aime, a demain | I love you, see you tomorrow |
| Tu es la premiere chose a laquelle je pense | You're the first thing I think about |
| Je t'embrasse | I kiss you / Kisses |

<VocabCard
  word="Je m'endors en pensant a toi"
  translation="I fall asleep thinking about you"
  pronunciation="[zhuh mahn-DOR ahn pahn-SAHN ah TWAH]"
  example="Bonne nuit, mon amour. Je m'endors en pensant a toi."
/>

### Throughout the Day

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Comment va mon amour? | How is my love? |
| Je pense a toi | I'm thinking of you |
| Tu me manques deja | I miss you already |
| J'ai hate de te retrouver | I can't wait to be with you again |
| Bonne journee, mon tresor | Have a good day, my treasure |

<VocabCard
  word="Juste un petit message pour te dire que je t'aime"
  translation="Just a little message to tell you I love you"
  pronunciation="[zhoost uhn puh-TEE meh-SAZH poor tuh DEER kuh zhuh TEHM]"
  example="Coucou! Juste un petit message pour te dire que je t'aime."
/>

## Romantic Compliments

### Physical Beauty

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Tu es magnifique | You are magnificent |
| Tu es a couper le souffle | You are breathtaking |
| Tu es resplendissant(e) | You are radiant |
| Tes yeux sont comme des etoiles | Your eyes are like stars |
| Tu as un corps de reve | You have a dream body |
| Tu es la plus belle femme du monde | You are the most beautiful woman in the world |
| Tu es l'homme le plus beau que j'aie jamais vu | You are the most handsome man I've ever seen |

<VocabCard
  word="Tu es belle/beau a en couper le souffle"
  translation="You are so beautiful it takes my breath away"
  pronunciation="[too ay bell/boh ah ahn koo-PAY luh SOOF-luh]"
  example="Ce soir, tu es belle a en couper le souffle."
/>

### Inner Beauty

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Tu as un coeur en or | You have a heart of gold |
| Tu es une personne incroyable | You are an incredible person |
| Tu me rends meilleur(e) | You make me better |
| J'admire ta force | I admire your strength |
| Tu es si attentionne(e) | You are so thoughtful |
| Tu as une belle ame | You have a beautiful soul |

<VocabCard
  word="Ce que j'aime le plus chez toi, c'est ton coeur"
  translation="What I love most about you is your heart"
  pronunciation="[suh kuh ZHEHM luh ploo shay TWAH say tohn KUHR]"
  example="Tu es belle, bien sur, mais ce que j'aime le plus chez toi, c'est ton coeur."
/>

<CultureTip title="French Compliments" flag="üá´üá∑">
The French appreciate sincere, specific compliments over generic ones. Instead of just "Tu es belle," try "J'adore comment tes yeux brillent quand tu ris" (I love how your eyes shine when you laugh). Details show you're paying attention!
</CultureTip>

## Comfort and Support

### Being There

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Je suis la pour toi | I'm here for you |
| Tu peux compter sur moi | You can count on me |
| On va s'en sortir ensemble | We'll get through this together |
| Je te soutiens | I support you |
| Ne t'inquiete pas, mon amour | Don't worry, my love |
| Quoi qu'il arrive, je t'aime | Whatever happens, I love you |

<VocabCard
  word="Je serai toujours a tes cotes"
  translation="I will always be by your side"
  pronunciation="[zhuh suh-RAY too-ZHOOR ah tay KOH-tay]"
  example="Dans les bons et les mauvais moments, je serai toujours a tes cotes."
/>

### After a Disagreement

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Je suis desole(e) | I'm sorry |
| Pardonne-moi | Forgive me |
| Je ne voulais pas te faire de mal | I didn't want to hurt you |
| Tu es plus important(e) que ca | You're more important than this |
| On recommence? | Shall we start over? |
| Je t'aime meme quand on se dispute | I love you even when we argue |

<VocabCard
  word="Notre amour est plus fort que tout"
  translation="Our love is stronger than anything"
  pronunciation="[notr ah-MOOR ay ploo FOR kuh TOO]"
  example="On a eu un moment difficile, mais notre amour est plus fort que tout."
/>

## Phrases for Special Moments

### Anniversary

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Joyeux anniversaire de mariage | Happy wedding anniversary |
| Voici a encore de nombreuses annees | Here's to many more years |
| Chaque annee avec toi est un cadeau | Every year with you is a gift |
| Je t'aime plus que le premier jour | I love you more than the first day |

### Valentine's Day

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Joyeuse Saint-Valentin | Happy Valentine's Day |
| Tu es mon valentin/ma valentine | You are my valentine |
| Mon coeur t'appartient | My heart belongs to you |
| Sois ma valentine pour toujours | Be my valentine forever |

<VocabCard
  word="Chaque jour est la Saint-Valentin avec toi"
  translation="Every day is Valentine's Day with you"
  pronunciation="[shahk ZHOOR ay la san-vah-lahn-TAN ah-vek TWAH]"
  example="Je n'ai pas besoin d'un jour special - chaque jour est la Saint-Valentin avec toi."
/>

## Classic French Love Quotes

These timeless expressions add poetry to your declarations:

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| L'amour est aveugle | Love is blind |
| Loin des yeux, pres du coeur | Far from the eyes, close to the heart |
| Apres la pluie, le beau temps | After rain comes sunshine |
| Un seul etre vous manque et tout est depeuple | One being is missing and the whole world feels empty |
| Le coeur a ses raisons que la raison ne connait point | The heart has its reasons that reason doesn't know |

<VocabCard
  word="Tu es ma raison de vivre"
  translation="You are my reason for living"
  pronunciation="[too ay ma ray-ZON duh VEEV-ruh]"
  example="Sans exageration, tu es ma raison de vivre."
/>

## Quick Reference by Occasion

| Occasion | French Phrase |
|----------|---------------|
| First date | Tu me plais beaucoup |
| Saying I love you (first time) | Je suis amoureux/amoureuse de toi |
| Daily affection | Je t'aime, mon coeur |
| Missing them | Tu me manques tellement |
| Compliment | Tu es magnifique |
| Support | Je suis la pour toi |
| Apology | Pardonne-moi, je t'aime |
| Proposal | Veux-tu m'epouser? |
| Anniversary | Je t'aime plus que jamais |

## Your Romantic French Journey

Now you have a complete arsenal of romantic French phrases for every moment in your relationship. Start with a few that feel natural, practice them with your partner, and gradually expand your romantic vocabulary.

Remember: in French, it's not just what you say but how you say it. The melody of the language itself is romantic - let it flow naturally, and your words will carry even more meaning.

> Mon amour, tu es tout pour moi. Je t'aime de tout mon coeur, aujourd'hui et pour toujours. Tu es la plus belle chose qui me soit jamais arrivee, et je veux passer chaque moment de ma vie a tes cotes.

<CTA
  text="Ready to master French with your partner? Practice with AI voice chat, save phrases to your Love Log, and your partner can be your tutor. Perfect for bilingual couples!"
  buttonText="Start Now"
/>

articles.title: Spanish Past Tense for Couples: Preterite vs Imperfect
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

One of the most beautiful aspects of learning Spanish as a couple is being able to share your memories, tell stories about how you met, and reminisce about special moments together. To do this effectively, you need to master the Spanish past tenses: the **preterite** (pret√©rito) and the **imperfect** (imperfecto).

Understanding when to use each tense might seem challenging at first, but when you practice with your partner, it becomes a meaningful way to share your history and dreams while improving your Spanish skills.

## Understanding the Two Past Tenses

### The Preterite: Completed Actions

The **preterite** (el pret√©rito) is used for actions that were completed at a specific point in the past. Think of it as a snapshot - a single, finished moment in time.

<VocabCard
  word="pret√©rito"
  translation="preterite (past tense)"
  pronunciation="[preh-TEH-ree-toh]"
  example="El pret√©rito describe acciones completadas."
/>

**Use the preterite for:**
- Actions completed at a specific time
- Events that happened once
- Beginning or end of an action
- A series of completed actions

### The Imperfect: Ongoing or Habitual Actions

The **imperfect** (el imperfecto) describes ongoing situations, habitual actions, or background descriptions in the past. Think of it as a video - continuous, flowing, without a clear beginning or end.

<VocabCard
  word="imperfecto"
  translation="imperfect (past tense)"
  pronunciation="[eem-pehr-FEHK-toh]"
  example="El imperfecto describe acciones continuas."
/>

**Use the imperfect for:**
- Ongoing situations in the past
- Habitual or repeated actions
- Descriptions (weather, time, feelings, appearances)
- Age and time expressions
- Two simultaneous ongoing actions

## Preterite Conjugation Patterns

### Regular -AR Verbs: Hablar (to speak)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="hablar (preterite)"
  meaning="to speak"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "habl√©", translation: "I spoke" },
    { person: "T√∫", word: "hablaste", translation: "You spoke" },
    { person: "√âl/Ella", word: "habl√≥", translation: "He/She spoke" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "hablamos", translation: "We spoke" },
    { person: "Vosotros", word: "hablasteis", translation: "You all spoke" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "hablaron", translation: "They spoke" }
  ]}
/>

### Regular -ER/-IR Verbs: Comer (to eat)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="comer (preterite)"
  meaning="to eat"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "com√≠", translation: "I ate" },
    { person: "T√∫", word: "comiste", translation: "You ate" },
    { person: "√âl/Ella", word: "comi√≥", translation: "He/She ate" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "comimos", translation: "We ate" },
    { person: "Vosotros", word: "comisteis", translation: "You all ate" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "comieron", translation: "They ate" }
  ]}
/>

## Imperfect Conjugation Patterns

### Regular -AR Verbs: Amar (to love)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="amar (imperfect)"
  meaning="to love"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "amaba", translation: "I used to love / was loving" },
    { person: "T√∫", word: "amabas", translation: "You used to love" },
    { person: "√âl/Ella", word: "amaba", translation: "He/She used to love" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "am√°bamos", translation: "We used to love" },
    { person: "Vosotros", word: "amabais", translation: "You all used to love" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "amaban", translation: "They used to love" }
  ]}
/>

### Regular -ER/-IR Verbs: Querer (to want/love)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="querer (imperfect)"
  meaning="to want/love"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "quer√≠a", translation: "I used to want / was wanting" },
    { person: "T√∫", word: "quer√≠as", translation: "You used to want" },
    { person: "√âl/Ella", word: "quer√≠a", translation: "He/She used to want" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "quer√≠amos", translation: "We used to want" },
    { person: "Vosotros", word: "quer√≠ais", translation: "You all used to want" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "quer√≠an", translation: "They used to want" }
  ]}
/>

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Cuando te conoc√≠, supe que eras especial"
  translation="When I met you, I knew you were special"
  pronunciation="[KWAN-doh teh koh-noh-SEE, SOO-peh keh EH-rahs ehs-peh-SYAHL]"
  context="A romantic phrase combining preterite (conoc√≠, supe) and imperfect (eras)"
/>

## When to Use Each Tense: Romantic Examples

### Telling Your Love Story

**Preterite** - The key moments:
- "**Te conoc√≠** en una fiesta" (I met you at a party)
- "**Nos besamos** por primera vez" (We kissed for the first time)
- "**Me enamor√©** de ti inmediatamente" (I fell in love with you immediately)

**Imperfect** - The background and feelings:
- "**Estaba** nervioso/a" (I was nervous)
- "**Llevabas** un vestido azul" (You were wearing a blue dress)
- "**Hac√≠a** fr√≠o esa noche" (It was cold that night)

<CultureTip title="Storytelling in Spanish" flag="üá™üá∏">
Spanish speakers often use both tenses in the same story. The imperfect sets the scene (Era una noche hermosa - It was a beautiful night), while the preterite moves the action forward (De repente, te vi - Suddenly, I saw you). This combination creates vivid, romantic narratives.
</CultureTip>

## Practice Exercises for Couples

### Exercise 1: How We Met Story

Take turns telling the story of how you met, using both tenses:

**Example:**
"**Era** un d√≠a soleado (imperfect - sets the scene). **Yo estaba** en el caf√© (imperfect - ongoing action). **T√∫ entraste** (preterite - completed action) y **me miraste** (preterite). **Sent√≠** algo especial (preterite - specific moment)."

### Exercise 2: Childhood Memories

Share childhood memories using the imperfect for habitual actions:

| Spanish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Cuando era ni√±o/a... | When I was a child... |
| Siempre jugaba... | I always used to play... |
| Mi familia viv√≠a en... | My family used to live in... |
| Todos los veranos, √≠bamos a... | Every summer, we would go to... |

### Exercise 3: Important Dates

Practice preterite with specific events in your relationship:

<VocabCard
  word="Nuestra primera cita fue..."
  translation="Our first date was..."
  pronunciation="[NWES-trah pree-MEH-rah SEE-tah fweh]"
  example="Nuestra primera cita fue en un restaurante italiano."
/>

## Common Irregular Verbs

### Ser (to be) - Imperfect

<ConjugationTable
  verb="ser (imperfect)"
  meaning="to be"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "era", translation: "I was / used to be" },
    { person: "T√∫", word: "eras", translation: "You were" },
    { person: "√âl/Ella", word: "era", translation: "He/She was" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "√©ramos", translation: "We were" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "eran", translation: "They were" }
  ]}
/>

### Ir (to go) - Imperfect

<ConjugationTable
  verb="ir (imperfect)"
  meaning="to go"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Yo", word: "iba", translation: "I was going / used to go" },
    { person: "T√∫", word: "ibas", translation: "You were going" },
    { person: "√âl/Ella", word: "iba", translation: "He/She was going" },
    { person: "Nosotros", word: "√≠bamos", translation: "We were going" },
    { person: "Ellos/Ellas", word: "iban", translation: "They were going" }
  ]}
/>

## Key Time Expressions

### Preterite Triggers

| Spanish | English |
|---------|---------|
| ayer | yesterday |
| anoche | last night |
| la semana pasada | last week |
| el a√±o pasado | last year |
| de repente | suddenly |
| una vez | once |

### Imperfect Triggers

| Spanish | English |
|---------|---------|
| siempre | always |
| a menudo | often |
| todos los d√≠as | every day |
| mientras | while |
| generalmente | generally |
| de ni√±o/a | as a child |

<VocabCard
  word="mientras"
  translation="while"
  pronunciation="[mee-EN-trahs]"
  example="Mientras t√∫ cocinabas, yo pon√≠a la mesa."
/>

## Romantic Sentences to Practice Together

1. "**Cuando te vi**, **supe** que **eras** el amor de mi vida."
   (When I saw you, I knew you were the love of my life.)

2. "**Est√°bamos** caminando cuando **empez√≥** a llover."
   (We were walking when it started to rain.)

3. "**Todos los domingos**, **√≠bamos** al parque."
   (Every Sunday, we used to go to the park.)

4. "**Te llam√©** pero no **contestaste** porque **dorm√≠as**."
   (I called you but you didn't answer because you were sleeping.)

<CultureTip title="Love Letters in Spanish" flag="üá™üá∏">
Writing love letters using past tenses is a cherished tradition in Spanish-speaking cultures. Try writing a short letter to your partner describing a favorite memory together, using both preterite and imperfect tenses.
</CultureTip>

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

### Mistake 1: Using Preterite for Descriptions
**Wrong:** "Ella fue hermosa" (if describing how she looked at a moment)
**Correct:** "Ella era hermosa" (She was beautiful - description)

### Mistake 2: Using Imperfect for Completed Actions
**Wrong:** "Ayer com√≠a en un restaurante"
**Correct:** "Ayer com√≠ en un restaurante" (Yesterday I ate at a restaurant - completed)

### Mistake 3: Forgetting to Combine Tenses
**Better storytelling:** Use both! "**Llov√≠a** (imperfect) cuando **llegaste** (preterite) a casa."

## Building Your Past Tense Skills Together

Practice these scenarios with your partner:

1. **Memory Lane**: Take turns sharing childhood memories
2. **Our Story**: Retell how you met, using both tenses
3. **Photo Album**: Describe old photos using imperfect for descriptions
4. **Travel Stories**: Share past vacation experiences

Remember, mastering the past tenses allows you to share your history, reminisce about beautiful moments, and build a deeper connection through the Spanish language.

<CTA text="Ready to share your love story in Spanish?" buttonText="Start Learning Together" />

sections: ## When to Use Each Tense: Romantic Examples
